page.title: 02HILL FARMING
page.content: { } The area divides into two parts, farms which are near the common on the hill and farms in the valley. The hill farms have got a few small fields near the house, where they keep their animals in winter and make hay in summer. They have the right to turn their sheep and cattle out to graze on the common land but have to obey the rules of the Commoners Association. These restrict the number of animals they can put on the common and ensure that all the sheep are dipped at the same time. The Commoners Association have recently placed cattle_grids to stop the stock straying. Motorists complain about animals causing accidents on the roads.
